department_name: County of San Diego Department of Environmental Health and Quality - Food and Housing Division

grading_system.description: San Diego County uses a numerical scoring system (0-100) that converts to letter grades. Points are subtracted from a base score of 100 for violations: Major Risk Factors (4 points), Minor Risk Factors (2 points), and Good Retail Practices (1 point).

inspection_details.frequency: Risk-based routine inspections, typically 1-3 per year. Approximately 32,000+ inspections conducted annually across 14,000+ facilities.
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Any facility not receiving an 'A' grade on routine inspection is re-inspected. Facilities with scores below 70 or certain major violations result in automatic closure until compliance.
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Grade cards must be displayed near public entrance during hours of operation. Inspection reports are public information available through SD Food Info website and California Public Records Act requests.

fire_safety_authority.department_name: San Diego County Fire Marshal Program (for unincorporated areas) / City Fire Departments (for incorporated cities)
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Kitchen fire suppression systems must be inspected every 6 months per NFPA 96. Quarterly inspections required for high-volume 24-hour operations.
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual (every 6 months) for most commercial kitchen fire suppression systems; quarterly for high-risk facilities

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - California Health and Safety Code Part 7, Division 104, Sections 113700 et seq.
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections conducted by San Diego County DEHQ for unincorporated areas and contracted cities. Some incorporated cities conduct their own inspections.
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: San Diego County Code Chapter 61 - Food Facility Grading System; MEHKO (Microenterprise Home Kitchen Operations) ordinance; Catering ordinance

confidence_notes: Verified from official San Diego County Department of Environmental Health websites with detailed grading system documentation, scoring methodology, and inspection procedures clearly outlined.
verification_notes: All key information verified from official county sources. Fire safety inspection requirements confirmed from NFPA standards and local fire protection service providers.
